name: Kothaiyar Lower Dam
description: A dam and headworks, constructed 1897-1906 by the Travancore Public Works Department in the Kanniyakumari District, on the Kotayar (now Kodayer River). The Pechiparai Reservoir was formed by the construction of the Pechiparai Dam, which was built across the Kodayar River about 1 mi (1.6 km) below the confluence of the Kallar, Chittar and Kuttiyar tributaries.Constructed between 1897 and 1906, the famous Mookanthurai engineering project was led by Mr. Minchin - a European engineer - during the rule of Maharaja Moolam Thirunal in Travancore. The local residents famously referred to it as 'mookanthurai'.
location: Maruthamalai Waterfall, Kodayar Lower Camp Road, Tamil Nadu 629101, India.
